resources.string: Use the included quick settings (qs) tile to quickly switch screen resolution.
Includes a quick setting tile to toggle max hz
Turning this on for a long period may increase the app\'s battery consumption. Includes a quick setting tile to turn-on refresh rate monitor.
This will set the screen-off/AOD refresh rate to the lowest one to improve idle battery usage.\nScreen-off refresh rate: %s

%s resolution setting does not support high/adaptive refresh rate. Change the resolution and motion smoothness mode first in the settings. \n\nThis app can easily switch resolution and motion smoothness mode using the quick settings tile once WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission setup is performed using ADB.
%s resolution setting does not support high/adaptive refresh rate. You can quickly change the resolution using the quick setting tile included this app.

During Power Savings Mode, refresh rate is restricted to standard (60hz). Turn it off in the settings first and set the refresh rate mode to Adaptive/High. \n\nThis app can bypass this restriction once the WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission setup is performed using ADB.

Motion smoothness mode is currently set to Standard. Change it first in the settings. \n\nThis app can easily change the Motion Smoothness Mode to Adaptive/High once ADB setup is performed. This works even on Power Savings Mode.
If you lost premium because of resetting this device, enter activation code that was sent to your email to reactivate premium.

When adb setup is performed, you can do the following with this app: 
- Quickly switch screen resolutions 
- (Auto)apply/keep Adaptive or High motion smoothness on Power Saving Mode 
- Auto apply power saving mode on screen-off 
- Use the quick-doze mod (premium) 
- Apply Adaptive refresh rate mod even on non-natively supported device(premium) 
- Auto Sensors Off(premium)
Only one resolution defined in the system.
Refresh rates profile not yet loaded. Try again.
Show on top permission is not granted!
Error! Please check internet connection and try again.
Premium trial already used and expired.
No premium license found for this %s device.
Quickly enter into doze mode when the screen is off, without being interrupted by motion, to improve idle battery usage.
Initial maintenance window interval in minutes (0 = no maintenance window)

Doze mode extends battery life by deferring app background CPU and network activity. While in doze, the device periodically enters a maintenance window (MW), during which apps can complete pending work (syncs, jobs, etc.). The device will continue this cycle, doubling the length of MW interval each time. The longer the MW interval, the better the battery saving. Doze mode may cause notification delays on some apps. It will not affect SMS, High Priority FCM and apps which battery optimizations are disabled. Doze mode will deactivate once the device is unlocked.
Click \'Installed services\' on the window that will appear, then enable Galaxy Max Hz service
Keep Motion Smoothness on Power Saving Mode

%1$s needs an special permission to execute this feature. Click the ADB setup link below to learn how. 

TLDR: Run 'adb shell pm grant %2$s android.permission.WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS' 

This is a one time procedure.
This app needs permission to appear on top in order to work properly. You can disable the notification by long-pressing it and turning off the toggle that will appear.
For this app to run with stability, enable \'Allow background activity\' or disable \'Optimize battery usage\'.
Device sensors will automatically turn off while screen is off until the device is unlocked. This helps minimize battery-draining motion-triggered wakelocks while device is on stand by.

Important note: While SensorsOff tile is ON, the device\'s camera(s) and microphone(s), among other sensors, become inaccessible. Check whether your voice can be heard or not during call. If it cannot be heard and you receive call while the device is locked, you can long-press the SensorsOff tile to unlock the device and turn the SensorsOff tile off - after pressing the receive call button.
Do this first: Enable \'Sensors Off\' tile in Settings > Developer options > Quick settings developer tiles. >
To enable Developer options, go to Settings > About phone > Software info and tap \'Build number\' 7x.
Enable Galaxy Max Hz change/write system settings permission.
This service is required for galaxy max hz mods to work.
